column4: What does this mean: "cp: cannot stat `location': No such file or directory" ?
I'm trying to copy like this: "cp -r /location/*.a ~/otherloc/"
the first location is owned by root.
does location exist in the root directory /?
please give the output of llutz command
llutz  http://pastie.org/2213497
is /location just a placeholder or was it the wrong command?
placeholder.
so can you tell us the original command without placeholders which is giving back the issue?
sudo cp -r /media/sf_temp/partwriter\ v.4/*.cpp
sudo cp -r /media/sf_temp/partwriter\ v.4/*.cpp /home/aaron/code/
why don't you use <<"">>? your command contains a space
http://pastie.org/2213509
try "sudo cp -r "/media/sf_temp/partwriter v.4/*.cpp" /home/aaron/code/"
http://pastie.org/2213514
try "sudo cp -r "/media/sf_temp/partwriter\ v.4/*.cpp" /home/aaron/code/"
You're double-escaping the space.  That's no good.
http://pastie.org/2213524
you directory is called "partwriter\ v.4" it contains a space and special sign which is causing that issue
can't you just rename the directory?
Which directory?  and why would I rename it?
can you rename "partwriter v.4" to "partwriter"?
um...that's very difficult and I don't think there's a point to it.
